overview:
Tony Borck continually monitors current portfolio companies, evaluates new investment opportunities, and helps to establish industry relationships as a member of the Clean Technology team.

Prior to joining GEF in 2003, Mr. Borck analyzed and covered various industries and sectors including food manufacturing, enterprise software, Internet infrastructure, and data storage in the Equity Research department at Legg Mason Wood Walker, a Maryland-based investment bank.

Mr. Borck earned an MBA from George Washington University, where he received the International Business Graduate Award. He also holds a BS in Business Administration, with honors, from Elon University in North Carolina.
